section.title: Creating an Event Threshold Alert
section.para: Event threshold alerts are targeted to detect when certain events occur more often than they should for virtual machines. For example, if a virtual machine is powered on too many times in a specific interval.

procedure.title: To Create an Event Threshold Alert

step.para:
Click on the Alerts accordion, then click
(Configuration),
(Add a new Alert).
Type in a description for the alert.
Check Active when you feel that the alert is ready to be enabled.
From Based On, select VM and Instance.
For What to Evaluate, select Event Threshold.
In Notification Frequency, select how often you want to be notified if the event threshold is reached.
In the Event Threshold Parameters area:
From Event to Check, select Power Activity: PowerOnVM_Task_Complete.
From How Far Back to Check, select 15 Minutes.

After setting the parameters, you then select what you want the alert to do. You can send an email, create an SNMP Trap, let the alert show on the timeline, or send a management event to start an automation process.
